recommendations.recommendation:
`For fans`, because this will be best enjoyed by mature viewers with experience working in a corporate environment, and by viewers who are familiar with Japanese behavioral nuances (although this series is not nearly as demanding in that respect as [url=http://anidb.net/perl-bin/animedb.pl?show=anime&aid=6049]Sunred[/url]).
Worthy of joining the ranks of [url=http://anidb.net/perl-bin/animedb.pl?show=anime&aid=8242]Kaiji[/url] and Akagi. It might be interesting to rewatch Kaiji with this series still fresh in the mind.
[b][i]Elegant[/i] and focused, this show makes exceptional use of just a few variables. Theme and variations, expressed in anime character design.[/b]
Although I might not rewatch this as many times as [url=http://anidb.net/perl-bin/animedb.pl?show=anime&aid=3446]Akagi[/url], I will definitely do so at least once or twice.
(written after finishing ep 12)

What a criminally underrated show... Only few spin-offs supersede the original series, and this is one of those rare cases. Tonegawa is made into a lovable and relatable character, whose daily life is strangely entertaining and hilarious.
In Kaiji, Tonegawa is this ruthless adversary with a powerful presence and rigid diligence, this series depicts him as a struggling cog in the machine who gradually builds his grandeur.
Furthermore, the opening perfectly captures the spirit of this show.

anime.description: * Based on Kaiji spinoff manga written by http://anidb.net/cr53772 [Hagiwara Tensei] and illustrated by http://anidb.net/cr53771 [Hashimoto Tomohiro] and http://anidb.net/cr53773 [Miyoshi Tomoki], with assistance from http://anidb.net/cr9107 [Fukumoto Nobuyuki]. A humorous chronicle of the daily meeting-room problems of http://anidb.net/ch25682 [Tonegawa Yukio], who works as a middle manager for the whims of the evil, unreasonable business magnate http://anidb.net/ch10162 [Hyoudou Kazutaka]. Source: M-U Note: Previously this anime was split into 21 episodes for "Chuukan Kanriroku Tonegawa" and 3 episodes for "Ichinichi Gaishutsuroku Hanchou". In that split situation the 21 episodes of "Chuukan Kanriroku Tonegawa" correspond to episodes 1-13, 16-21 and 23-24 of its official episode count. Episodes 14-15 and 22 of the official count correspond to "Ichinichi Gaishutsuroku Hanchou".

tag.name: cooking
tag.description: Cooking is the process of preparing food by using heat.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: daily life
tag.description: The antics of the protagonists do not take place in some exotic setting or time, but in everyday life. When not "at the job" this means getting up in the morning, making meals, house cleaning, going shopping or out to eat, visiting the bath house or spa, leisure activities in the spare time, etc. The time "on the job" for students is School Life, for others working in their profession. Daily Life is basically a synonym for everything normal, repetitive, and trivial happening to your average person.

tag.name: male protagonist
tag.description: This anime has a male protagonist.

tag.name: gambling
tag.description: Gambling is the wagering of money or something of value (referred to as "the stakes") on an event with an uncertain outcome with the primary intent of winning additional money and/or material goods. Gambling thus requires three elements be present: consideration, chance and prize. The outcome of the wager is often immediate, such as a single roll of dice or a spin of a roulette wheel, but longer time frames are also common, allowing wagers on the outcome of a future sports contest or even an entire sports season. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: predominantly male cast
tag.description: The anime features a mostly male cast, i.e. female characters are rare. Example: Reverse harem setting with a plethora of bishounen.

tag.name: predominantly adult cast
tag.description: This show features mostly adults. That means children and teenagers are relatively rare and unlikely to hold significance to the plot. That is a rare trait in anime, as most shows spin around children or teenagers.

character.name: Itou Kaiji
character.description: Kaiji is poor, downtrodden and lazy - he lives by himself in a slum and is constantly in debt. He bides his time by playing cheap gambling games with neighbors, though he always loses. In spite of this, when his life is in danger, he displays a remarkable hidden capacity for gambling, which allows him to endure the hardships he faces. He is shouldered with a 3,850,000 yen debt at the beginning of the story by a coworker who convinced him into consigning a loan, leaving Kaiji with the full weight of the debt compounded over a year. Source: Taken from Kaiji Wikia

character.name: Hyoudou Kazutaka
character.description: Wealthy socialite and president of the powerful financial consulting firm "Teiai" ("Love Emperor"), not to mention owner and sponsor of underground gambling tournaments like those onboard Espoir. He is believed to be seventy years old and worth several hundred billion yen. Driven mad by wealth, conventional hobbies fail to entertain him, so he funds gambling tournaments to watch the destitute of society struggle against overwhelming terror and despair. He meets Kaiji in the final segment of the first series of manga, where Kaiji is selected by lottery to compete in the "Castle of Despair". Hyoudou`s talents for winning in anything have earned him the title of "king" by some, though others merely call him "very lucky". His first full manga appearance was in volume 8 - prior to that, all readers saw of Hyoudou was his finger tapping. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: Ichijou Seiya
character.description: Ichijou is the dastardly manager of an illegal casino.

character.name: Endou Yuuji
character.description: Endou Yuuji is a dirty loan shark with ties to the yakuza. He lends out large sums of money to the desperate, but charges an absurd (and illegal) interest rate. He tracks down Kaiji after a client of his, Furuhata, disappeared without repaying a loan, which Kaiji cosigned in an act of weakness. Recognizing Kaiji could never repay the loan, Endou offers him the opportunity to board the gambling ship Espoir, where he would be able repay his debt and make some money as well.

character.name: Ootsuki
character.description: Ootsuki is the foreman of Kaiji`s gang. While he initially appears to be kind and helpful, in reality, he is just setting Kaiji up for an even bigger fall.

character.name: Numakawa
character.description: Numakawa is one of http://anidb.net/ch31473 [Ootsuki]`s sidekicks.

character.name: Isawa
character.description: Isawa is yet another of http://anidb.net/ch31473 [Ootsuki]`s cronies.

character.name: Odagiri
character.description: Odagiri is the foreman of Team C.

character.name: Honda Masayasu
character.description: Honda Masayasu is the body double of http://anidb.net/ch10162 [Hyoudou Kazutaka].

character.name: Yamazaki Kenji
character.description: Yamazaki Kenji is a trusted member of Tonegawa`s team. He first caught Tonegawa`s attention when he suggested a game that would eventually become the game of Restricted Rock-Paper-Scissors, a proposal which impressed Tonegawa. Soon, Tonegawa began to trust Yamazaki more than most other team members, coming to discuss several issues with Yamazaki before bringing them to the team`s attention and allowing Yamazaki to cover for him whenever he is absent.

character.name: Ebitani
character.description: Ebitani was a part of http://anidb.net/ch25682 [Tonegawa]`s team. His boss thought of him as clueless, yet passionate. Not too long after joining Tonegawa`s team, his rivalry with http://anidb.net/ch96453 [Yamazaki Kenji] and idiocy resulted in a horribly-planned, horribly-executed manoeuvre which angered http://anidb.net/ch10162 [the Teiai Group president], who promptly fired him personally. After getting fired, and despite receiving help from his former boss, he struggled to recover from his predicament. Having lost everything, Ebitani began to criticize his former employer in social media and gained a significant following. However, Tonegawa eventually caught wind of Ebitani`s actions and compelled him to fix the damage he had caused by pressing him as the new social media manager of the Teiai Group.

character.name: Teiai Group
character.description: The Teiai Group (lit. love emperor) is a shady financial consulting company, whose possessions include a hotel, casino, and a mine. They also host several "death games".

character.name: Yukioh
character.description: Despite his brown color, the name he is given literally means "snow".

character.name: Team Tonegawa
character.description: Team Tonegawa is a subdivision of http://anidb.net/ch101409 [Teia Group], eponymous to its leader http://anidb.net/ch25682 [Tonegawa Yukio]. It was assembled by http://anidb.net/ch10162 [Hyoudou Kazutaka], in order to invent and organize a bunch of gambling games that would amuse him.

character.name: Miyamoto
character.description: Miyamoto is a Teiai employer who is often charged with following Ootsuki.

character.name: Kagawa Maho
character.description: Kagawa Maho is Tonegawa`s former classmate. She also confessed her love towards the latter but was rejected.

character.name: Shinanogawa
character.description: Shinanogawa is Tonegawa`s former classmate. Together they were called the "Ragin Rivers Duo", due to the fact that Shinanogawa is the name of the longest river in Japan, while Tonegawa river has the greatest surface in Japan.

character.name: Kinezaki
character.description: Kinezaki is the strict head of Teia Group`s Kansai branch. He is the only Teia executive whose tuxedo is dyed purple.

character.name: Hagio (Otouto)
character.description: Hagio is the younger brother of http://anidb.net/ch96459 [Hagio Jun`ichi]. He offered to work for http://anidb.net/ch101409 [Teia Group], but was disqualified because he looks similar to his brother and http://anidb.net/ch96457 [Ogino Keiichi].

episode.title: 大人
Adult
Otona
episode.summary: After three unproductive meetings and a company trip, Tonegawa`s team still has essentially nothing to show in terms of progress on their death game project. But after a bolt of inspiration, the middle manager himself thinks he might have the answer. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 鉄板
Surefire
La plaque de cuisson
Teppan
episode.summary: After a vicious act of betrayal in the last meeting, Tonegawa arranges weekend trip to an all-expenses paid villa to repair the cracks in his relationship with the team... but will it be enough? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 忖度
Conjecture
Intuition
Sontaku
episode.summary: The second meeting of the death game production team is held, and Tonegawa needs to make up for the bad first impression he gave his workers. But between the confusing names of his team members and their bizarre objective, can the executive make sure the conversation heads in a productive direction? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 始動
Initiative
Toujours ensemble au boulot !!
Shidou
episode.summary: In Kaiji: Ultimate Survivor, he tormented the downtrodden and enticed them into playing games where their lives were wagered against incredible cash prizes. But even a cold blooded monster can`t spend every moment of the day trampling others. And in the real world, death games require planning, funding, oversight, and execution. This is the story of a lone man who struggles between his employer, the president, and his own employees, the men in black...Tonegawa Yukio: Middle Manager! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 海老
Shrimp
Ebi
episode.summary: After being fired from Teiai and causing Tonegawa`s salary to be cut, Ebitani returns hoping to make amends. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 蔓延
Proliferation
Man`en
episode.summary: As work begins to proceed on the first Restricted Rock Paper Scissors game, an unseen danger threatens to freeze the team`s work to a standstill. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 自爆
Self-Destruct
Jibaku
episode.summary: As the deadline for the design of the Restricted Rock Paper Scissors cards approaches, Ebitani feels insecure because of Saemon`s repeated successes. Tonegawa tries to mentor the wayward employee, but will he listen? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 猛省
Soul-Searching
Mousei
episode.summary: With the proposal for Restricted Rock Paper Scissors finished, Tonegawa just needs to turn it in to President Hyoudou... The tyrannical, temperamental, explosively volatile President Hyoudou. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 似非
Fake
Ese
episode.summary: When President Hyoudou decides that he wants a body double, Tonegawa and the men in black begin a search to find the perfect doppelganger for their boss. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 出張
Business Trip
Shucchou
episode.summary: Tonegawa hits the road, with business to attend to outside of Tokyo, and hopes to find a chance for relaxation while away from home. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: リハ
Rehearsal
Riha
episode.summary: It`s finally time for the first rehearsal game of Restricted Rock Paper Scissors. But will difficulties with equipment and participants spell trouble for Tonegawa`s big project? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: カツ
Cutlets
Katsu
episode.summary: The annual round of hiring for Teiai has begun, with Tonegawa and Yamazaki interviewing potential new employees. Afterwards, Tonegawa goes out for lunch, but ends up getting a little more than he bargained for. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 出航
Setting Sail
Shukkou
episode.summary: The day is finally here: Tonegawa and his team are going to host the first game of Restricted Rock Paper Scissors. It`s all been leading up to this, but can they pull it off without a hitch? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 豪遊
Playing Hard
Gouyuu
episode.summary: One of Ootsuki`s regular excursions results in a clash of epic proportions, against an unexpected opponent... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 天敵
Natural Enemies
Tenteki
episode.summary: Tonegawa is Teiai`s number two man, but his position isn`t exactly uncontested. When his rival, Kurosawa, steps into the picture even the battle hardened middle manager finds himself at a loss. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 内示
Unofficial Announcement
Naiji
episode.summary: The time has come for personnel changes at Teiai. When everything is said and done, who will be left on Team Tonegawa? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 外出
Excursion
Gaishutsu
episode.summary: We`ve seen that the Teiai Group runs a ruthless business. But what happens when people with debt stacked beyond the ceiling fail to show any signs of paying off their loans? Witness a trip into the secret hell on Earth inhabited by the most hapless of debtors... and how one man manages to make the most of his otherwise dire situation. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 同調
Alignment
Douchou
episode.summary: Tonegawa`s annual check-up leads to some lifestyle changes that are accompanied by unwanted attention, while Ootsuki finds something he never expected to encounter on one of his excursions. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 新人
Newcomers
Shinjin
episode.summary: With the recent transfers leaving him short-manned, Tonegawa welcomes three new employees to his team, and doesn`t take long for two of them to start making waves within the company. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 接待
Entertaining
Settai
episode.summary: The man-eating Bog is a pachinko machine that makes a ludicrous amount of money for one of Teiai`s underground casinos. The time has come for Tonegawa to collect the winnings, which means a showdown between him, the diabolical device, and the man who responsible for it: Ichijou! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 中傷
Defamation
Chuushuu
episode.summary: Overseeing the Teiai corporate Twitter exposes Tonegawa to an account that seems to exist solely to hate on his company, triggering the middle manager`s combative instincts. Meanwhile, Ootsuki`s underground gambling games hit a snag when a rival foreman begins running his own entertainment scheme. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 後編
Conclusions
Kouhen
episode.summary: Two stories come to a conclusion, as Ootsuki concocts a scheme to usurp Odagiri`s movie business, and Tonegawa tracks down the social media troll that has been flaming Teiai. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 予感
Premonition
Yokan
episode.summary: Tonegawa attends a class reunion where he hopes to see what`s become of the classmates he always held in contempt. Meanwhile, Ootsuki`s latest excursion is threatened when he gets unexpectedly sick. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 終着
End of the Line
Shuuchaku
episode.summary: Hyoudou`s latest craving for diabolical entertainment is so twisted, people are afraid to talk about it... even the narrator! And then, wedding bells begin to ring for one member of Team Tonegawa. Source: crunchyroll
